identificationModule.briefTitle: Optimization of Deep Brain Stimulation Parameters in Patients With Medically Refractory Epilepsy
identificationModule.officialTitle: Optimization of Deep Brain Stimulation Parameters in Patients With Medically Refractory Epilepsy

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Deep brain stimulation (DBS) is used to treat epilepsy in cases where patients are medically refractory and are not candidates for surgical resection. This therapy has been shown to be effective in seizure reduction, yet very few patients achieve the ultimate goal of seizure freedom. Implantable neural stimulators (INSs) have many parameters that may be adjusted, and could be tuned to achieve very patient specific therapies. This study will develop a platform for stimulation setting optimization based on power spectral density (PSD) measures.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Participants will be randomly assigned to a stimulation order at the baseline visit with optimized settings (OS) stimulation occurring for a total of 8 months and physician-selected settings (PS) stimulation chosen for a total of 4 months. For example, a patient may undergo PS setting stimulation from 4-8 months, then undergo OS setting stimulation from 8-12 and 12-16 months. Thus, there are three possible stimulation groups (1. PS, OS, OS; 2.OS, PS, OS; 3. OS, OS, PS).

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: A study coordinator who is blinded to the chosen stimulation setting will check the data daily to ensure the patient is wearing the device properly and recording seizure events. At each optimization visit, the MoCA and QOLIE-10P surveys will also be administered to the participants by a member of the research team who is blinded to the group the participant is assigned to.

armGroups.label: Stimulation Group A
armGroups.description: Participants with already implanted DBS will receive stimulation order 1. PS, OS, OS.
interventionNames: Other: PS and OS stimulation order 1

armGroups.label: Stimulation Group B
armGroups.description: Participants with already implanted DBS will receive stimulation order 1. OS, PS, OS.
interventionNames: Other: PS and OS stimulation order 2

armGroups.label: Stimulation Group C
armGroups.description: Participants with already implanted DBS will receive stimulation order 1. OS, OS, PS.
interventionNames: Other: PS and OS stimulation order 3

primaryOutcomes.measure: Difference in broadband power with different settings
primaryOutcomes.description: Different settings include different combinations of stimulation amplitude, frequency and pulse width. The full spectrum PSD data from all of the in-clinic recordings at all of the unique settings will be combined to look at the resulting difference in broadband power.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Difference in frequency band-specific low-frequency power (LFP) with different settings
primaryOutcomes.description: Different settings include different combinations of stimulation amplitude, frequency and pulse width. The full spectrum PSD data from all of the in-clinic recordings at all of the unique settings will be combined to look at the resulting difference in frequency band-specific LFP.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Detecting generalized tonic-clonic seizures using a wearable sensor wristband and patients-reported seizure activity.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Scores on Montreal Cognitive Assessment, MoCA
secondaryOutcomes.description: This is a brief cognitive assessment used to look at side effects of stimulation settings

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Scores on epilepsy-specific quality of life questionnaire (QOLIE-10P)
secondaryOutcomes.description: This is a brief cognitive assessment used to look at side effects of stimulation settings

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* medically refractory epilepsy
* already have a deep brain stimulator in place

Exclusion Criteria:

* severe dementia at investigator discretion
